data: Yes, the #COP26 will succeed if we, States and organisations, do everything in our power to achieve carbon neutrality by 2050 with clear, concrete plans of action. Let us all make this commitment. The time for action is now, not tomorrow.

data: The #COP26 will succeed if we state, loudly and clearly, our shared determination to end deforestation. France was the first European country to adopt a strategy for combatting imported deforestation. The lungs of our planet are at stake and we need to save them.

The #COP26 will succeed if the protection of nature, our essential ally against climate disruption, is genuinely enhanced. In France, 30% of our territory is to be protected as of early 2022. I call on our partners to take action to safeguard our vital heritage.

data: The #COP26 will succeed if the countries with the most resources mobilise 100 billion dollars to support the transition of the countries who have less. France is doing its share, dedicating 7 billion annually to this transition around the globe.

The #COP26 will succeed if every country accelerates their shift from coal. I made such a commitment for France and we will honour it. I call on our partners to make the same pledge.

data: We established COVAX to make sure that the most vulnerable countries would have access to vaccines. But it is not enough. The battle is far from over. The global vaccination divide remains unacceptable, and the gap must be closed.

We must address two challenges at the same time. The first is the immediate response to the crisis. The second is to prepare, as of today, for the future, and to make sure that, together, we will be ready to address similar pandemics in the future.
